revised_title: Observations of Sunspots and the Changing Appearance of Saturn
tldr: This article discusses the observations of sunspots made at the Royal Academy in Paris and the changing appearance of Saturn. The author notes the sunspots' movement and shape, as well as their periodic revolution around the sun. Additionally, the article mentions the unexpected change in Saturn's appearance, which supports the hypothesis of Christiaan Huygens regarding the planet's flat ring structure.
